title: Graph of electric field from potential graph

content.question: A solid metallic sphere of radius R has charge Q uniformly distributed on its outer surface. A graph of electric potential V as a function of position r is shown above. Which of the following graphs best represents the magnitude of the electric field E as a function of position r for this sphere?

choices.label: Choice A is a set of axes with electric field E on the y-axis and position lowercase r on the x-axis. Four tick marks are shown on the y-axis above the origin, with horizontal dashed lines drawn from the second and fourth tick marks. Two tick marks are shown on the x-axis to the right of the origin, with the first labelled uppercase R and the second labelled 2 times uppercase R and vertical dashed lines drawn from both. Choice A starts at the origin and increases linearly to the fourth y-axis tick mark and position uppercase R, then is decreasing and concave down, ending at the first y-axis tick mark and position 2 times uppercase R.

Choice B is a set of axes with electric field E on the y-axis and position lowercase r on the x-axis. Choice B starts at the origin and increases linearly to the fourth y-axis tick mark and position uppercase R, then is decreasing and concave down, ending at the second y-axis tick mark and position 2 times uppercase R.

Choice C is a set of axes with electric field E on the y-axis and position lowercase r on the x-axis. Choice C starts at the origin and is horizontal along the x-axis to position uppercase R, then jumps to the fourth y-axis tick mark and position uppercase R and is decreasing and concave down, ending at the first y-axis tick mark and position 2 times uppercase R.

Choice E is a set of axes with electric field E on the y-axis and position lowercase r on the x-axis. Four tick marks are shown on the y-axis above the origin, with horizontal dashed lines drawn from the second and fourth tick marks.
